alert.note: Alert for Caswell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:37PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact much of Caswell County through 330 PM EDT... At 236 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorm with very heavy rainfall across the southern half of Caswell county from Camp Springs to Yanceyville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Very heavy rainfall. Frequent dangerous cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Yanceyville... Bethel... Jericho... Prospect Hill... Camp Springs... Quick... and Leasburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
